description.text: Perform daily visual inspection to identify leaks, unusual noises, or abnormal conditions.
Ensure pump is running and system is at normal operating temperature.
Visually inspect pump casing, piping connections, and mechanical seal area for leaks.

warnings.text: Do not touch rotating parts or hot surfaces.

description.text: Listen for unusual noises such as cavitation, bearing noise, or impeller contact.
Check gauges for normal pressure and flow readings.

verification.text: Pressure should be 8-10 bar, flow rate 90-100 m3/h during normal operation.

description.text: Record observations in maintenance log and report any abnormalities.

safetyInstructions.text: Always wear appropriate PPE when near operating equipment.
Maintain safe distance from rotating parts.

description.text: Check bearing temperatures using infrared thermometer to detect early signs of wear or lubrication issues.
Allow pump to reach normal operating temperature (minimum 30 minutes runtime).
Using infrared thermometer, measure temperature at drive-end bearing housing.
Measure temperature at non-drive-end bearing housing.
Compare readings to previous measurements and baseline values.
Record measurements in maintenance tracking system.

safetyInstructions.text: Hot surfaces - do not touch bearing housings directly.
Maintain minimum 0.5m distance from rotating shaft.

description.text: Perform comprehensive vibration measurement and analysis to detect developing mechanical issues.
Set up vibration analyzer with appropriate accelerometer and settings for pump analysis.
Attach accelerometer to drive-end bearing housing (horizontal position).
Record vibration spectrum at drive-end horizontal position.

verification.text: Overall velocity should be <4.5 mm/s RMS per ISO 10816.

description.text: Repeat measurement at drive-end vertical and axial positions.
Move to non-drive-end and repeat all three position measurements.
Analyze spectra for characteristic frequencies: imbalance, misalignment, bearing defects.
Compare to baseline and trend data. Generate report with recommendations.

safetyInstructions.text: Do not position hands near rotating shaft when attaching sensors.
Use magnetic mount - do not use adhesive on hot surfaces.

description.text: Verify pump-motor alignment using laser alignment system and correct if necessary.
Lock out/tag out pump motor. Verify zero energy state.

warnings.text: CRITICAL: Follow LOTO procedure. Verify motor cannot start.

description.text: Allow pump and motor to reach ambient temperature (minimum 4 hours after shutdown).
Remove coupling guard and inspect coupling for wear or damage.
Mount laser alignment system on pump and motor shafts.
Perform alignment measurement. Record horizontal and vertical offset/angularity.
If out of tolerance, adjust motor position using shims and bolts.
Re-verify alignment after adjustments. Document final readings.
Reinstall coupling guard. Remove LOTO. Test run pump.

safetyInstructions.text: MANDATORY: Complete LOTO before any work on rotating equipment.
Verify coupling guard is properly installed before startup.

description.text: Complete pump disassembly, inspection, replacement of wear parts, and reassembly with full testing.
Complete LOTO procedure. Drain pump and isolate from system.

warnings.text: Ensure complete isolation from process fluid - may be hazardous.

description.text: Disconnect coupling, remove motor. Tag all electrical connections.
Remove pump from baseplate. Transport to workshop.
Disassemble pump: remove casing bolts, back pull-out, impeller, shaft.
Inspect all components: impeller wear, shaft runout, bearing condition, seal faces.

verification.text: Document all measurements. Compare to OEM tolerances.

description.text: Replace mechanical seal, bearings, and any worn components.
Reassemble pump following OEM torque specifications.
Reinstall pump, couple to motor, perform alignment.
Test run: verify no leaks, normal vibration, correct rotation, rated performance.

verification.text: Flow and head must meet 95% of rated values minimum.

safetyInstructions.text: Use appropriate lifting equipment for pump (weight: 85kg).
Wear chemical-resistant PPE when handling process-wetted parts.
